intro: Seseli montanum var. prasinum, commonly known as green mountain seseli, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
